results.title: Treasures of the earth
results.brief_description: Highlights some of the new techniques being used in exploration, transporting and handling of natural resources in order to meet the increasing needs of modern society. Demonstrates new methods employing electronics, computers, lasers, aircraft, heavy machinery, and seismic equipment in locating additional resources on land and beneath the seas. Industrial promotional film for Litton Industries.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Warwick Gilbert, Roz Phillips and Burbank Films Australia
results.brief_description: When an old sea dog Billy Bones dies at the “Admiral Benbow Inn”, Jim Hawkins and Dr. Liversey come into possession of a map revealing the where- abouts of treasure hidden by the infamous Captain Kidd. They set out on the sailing ship “Hispaniola” to find the hoard and make their fortunes. In the great tradition of swashbuckling adventure stories Robert Louis Stevenson’s tale has taken its place among the best known and most widely read by children of all ages. Ross Higgins stars as the voice of Long John Silver and brings this animated video to life.

results.title: Traffic control
results.brief_description: The basic principles of traffic control - chiefly by manual signals - at busy intersections. It is intended to assist in the instruction of traffic control officers who deal with London’s traffic problems

results.title: Toyland revolt
results.creator_credit: H Tyrlova, T.R. Sadek, J Novotny and Czechoslovakia Film Corporation, Documentary Film Department, Section Zlin
results.brief_description: A combination of live actors and animated puppets tell the story of the revolt of the toys when an S.S. man invades a toymaker’s shop and forces the old man to flee. The toys unite in their struggle to defeat the evils of Nazism. Cast: Edvard Linkers and Jindra Laznicka.

results.title: Towards new horizons
results.creator_credit: Douglas Gray, Educational Films of Scotland and Park Film Studios
results.brief_description: Against a backdrop of Scottish mountains, rivers, lochs and seas, shows favourite youth activities available in Scotland. Skiing, cycling, pony trekking, camping and climbing are included.

results.title: Toulouse Lautrec
results.creator_credit: Peter Riethof and Peter Riethof Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatises the life of the French artist, Toulouse Lautrec. His paintings and sketches are used to portray his youth, background, adult life, physical handicaps and the world of Paris cafes, nightclubs and theatres in which he lived. Lautrec recorded the Paris scene in pitiless detail in his sketches, paintings, and lithographed posters; Sarah Bernhardt at the Comedi Francaise; La Goulou, dancing the can-can; scenes in the midnight clubs - the seamier side of Paris; the ruined absinthe drinkers; the prostitutes and the midinettes.

results.title: Touch wood
results.creator_credit: W.J. Pearson, T.P. Deamer and Castlereagh
results.brief_description: Presents a 1960’s perspective of Australian Timber development: The many possibilities available in the use of timber in the construction and interior decoration of private homes. Described in a fairy tale idiom. Narrated by Roger Climpson.
